title: Bicycle parking, 10' ceilings with exposed brick in many units
posting_body: Inside and Out, Arc Light is home in a class of its own.
This is a 2 Bedroom, 1 Bath, approximately 681-697 Sq.
At the center of it all, these gorgeous South Park loft homes are steps from Giants Stadium, the Theater District and San Francisco Bay.
Hip and elegant, with custom finishes, spacious layouts, floor-to-ceiling windows and exposed brick walls, Arc Light offers unparalleled luxury in a friendly, sustainable apartment community
Elaborately landscaped roof decks offer year-round outdoor entertaining with grilling, lounge seating, custom stone and tile spa, and magnificent city views.
**Prices and specials are subject to change, please contact the leasing office for more info**
- Gourmet kitchens with custom cabinetry, honed granite countertops, stainless steel appliances and high-end fixtures
- Oversized 8' birch wood doors with stainless steel hardware
- Private outdoor balconies with sliding glass doors in many units
- Baths finished with custom cabinetry, honed limestone countertops, porcelain soaking tubs, oversized rainhead showers, vessel sinks and high-end fixtures
- 10' ceilings with exposed brick in many units
- Bedrooms with distinctive wood and glass sliding wall panels and polished chrome, dual-head ceiling fans
- Expansive windows with city views in many units
- Custom window and shower treatments with stainless steel hardware
- LEED™ for Homes Mid-rise Gold-Certified residential project
- Landscaped interior courtyards with exposed historic brick, integral concrete colored benches and dramatic uplighting
- Two elaborately landscaped roof decks, featuring:
- Fitness center with roof deck views
- Sun decks with lounge seating, Custom stone and tile spa, Grilling area, Enclosed dog run, Magnificent city views
- Enclosed garage parking with controlled access

This unit is a rental unit subject to the San Francisco Rent Ordinance, which limits evictions without just cause, and which states that any waiver by a tenant of their rights under the Rent Ordinance is void as contrary to public policy.
